title: Ex-Cowboys running back Marion Barber facing up to two years in jail for criminal mischief
text:
Retired Dallas Cowboys running back Marion Barber III has been arrested in Texas for two misdemeanor counts of criminal mischief and has since been released on bond.

As The Dallas Morning News reported, the incident in question took place in July of 2018, but authorities have chosen not to release any further details into the allegations.

The 36-year-old faces up to one year behind bars and a $4,000 fine for each count, according to police. He was arrested late Wednesday evening.

According to the Texas penal code, criminal mischief involves one person or party intentionally damaging another person or party's property, causing a monetary loss or inconvenience.

Barber was previously detained for a mental health evaluation in 2014 when police were called to his home in Mansfield, Texas.

He was not arrested at the time, and details from that incident have not been released publicly.

An unheralded prospect out of Minnesota in the 2005 NFL Draft, Barber was taken by the Cowboys in the fourth round and shocked many by splitting time with fellow running back Julius Jones.

He went on to play for another six NFL seasons, five of which came with the Cowboys before retiring as a member of the Chicago Bears in 2011.

Barber retired with 4,780 career rushing yards and 60 total touchdowns.

Barber is the son of retired New York Jets running back Marion Barber Jr. and the cousin of Peyton Barber, who currently plays for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
